scenario:
Investors can align themselves with Wall Street firms by analyzing insider buying activity, particularly in stocks like Nike (NYSE: NKE), FedEx (NYSE: FDX), and Occidental Petroleum (NYSE: OXY). These companies have strong fundamental stories that justify double-digit upside in the coming months.

Nike stock has sold off to 68% of its 52-week high due to slowing overseas numbers, but billionaire value investor Bill Ackman has accumulated a stake of up to 3 million shares, betting on the company's international exposure and brand recognition. Wall Street analysts from Robert W. Baird have an outperformed rating on the stock with a $105 price target, indicating a 43.2% upside potential.

FedEx stock trades at 87% of its 52-week high and has attracted insider buying activity, with State Street accumulating up to $2.6 billion worth of the stock. Wall Street analysts from J.P. Morgan Chase have an overweight rating on the stock with a $370 valuation, indicating a 35% rally potential.

Occidental Petroleum stock trades at a significant discount on a price-to-book basis, with a 2.0x multiple compared to the energy sector's average 3.6x valuation. Warren Buffett has bought up to 29% of the stock, and Mizuho analysts see a fair valuation at $70 a share, indicating a 38.6% rally potential.
